abstract: In this investigation, students define potential energy and factors that impact the amount of potential energy that exists in a system. Students start by defining potential energy as energy that is stored in a system of interacting objects. Students then explore the relationship between potential energy and fields in order to explain how objects interact without touching. Finally, students evaluate factors that affect the amount of potential energy stored in a system. This investigation builds toward NGSS PEs: MS-PS3-2 and HS-PS3-5.
credits: The Concord Consortium and CREATE for STEM at MSU
description: Students further define potential energy and explore the relationship between potential energy and fields.
name: Unit 2 - Inv. 2: Where does the energy of a spark come from? (v2)
